name: foggily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
When people think or act foggily, their thoughts and memories are confused or not clear: James awoke foggily to the smell of frying eggs. "Where did I leave my wallet?" he thought, foggily.
More examplesFewer examplesHe left at about 11.30 p.m. and foggily remembers stopping by a bar in Union Square.We tried to apply to the problem what we foggily imagined to be lateral thinking.One critic felt that the characters were foggily defined and the heart of the story was left unexamined.
